snippet: Low interest rates let governments keep their borrowing costs low, helping them live within their budgets without having to raise taxes or cut spending.
abstract: Low interest rates are a burden for retirees across the globe who are trying to live off their savings, but are allowing governments to keep their own borrowing costs low and live within their budgets without having to raise taxes or cut spending; the United States government has saved trillions of dollars in interest payments over the nearly four years since the Federal Reserve System set its benchmark interest rate at zero.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman and Elvire Camus contributed reporting, and Gu Huini contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Low interest rates let governments keep their borrowing costs low, helping them live within their budgets without having to raise taxes or cut spending.

headline.seo: As Low Rates Depress Savers, Governments Reap the Benefits
headline.main: As Low Rates Depress Savers, Governments Reap Benefits
headline.print_headline: As Low Rates Depress Savers, Governments Reap the Benefits
